alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 7:45PM CDT until May 28 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Mccook 1se affecting Red Willow County. Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County. .The flood waters will continue to decline. However there is a possibility there could be additional rainfall over the flood warning areas tonight. If that happens a small rise in water levels can be expected before they fall again. For the Republican River...including Mccook 1se, Stratton, Benkelman 1sw...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Republican River At Mccook 1se. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Lowland areas will become flooded. Barnett Park will become inundated. At 10.0 feet, Flooding could become severe in nearby locations. The depth of the water could reach a foot in Barnett Park and other low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM CDT Saturday was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 6.2 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.6 feet on 07/29/2018. &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 745 AM CDT.
